text: Sandie Jones (9 November 1951 – 19 September 2019) was an Irish singer. She was born in Dublin. She represented Ireland in the Eurovision Song Contest of 1972 with the song "Ceol an Ghrá" (). This was the only time an Irish performer performed a song in the Irish language at Eurovision. Jones died of cancer under hospice care in Gunnison, Colorado, at the age of 68. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Colorado Category:Irish pop singers Category:Eurovision Song Contest entrants Category:Singers from Dublin
title: Sandie Jones
